step1.sentence: She decided to try new things after moving to a new city, starting with a cooking class she had always been curious about.

step2.story: Tom had always stuck to the same routine, but his friend encouraged him to try new things. He signed up for a salsa dance class and was surprised by how much he enjoyed it. Now he looks forward to every Thursday evening.

step3.story: After years of playing it safe, Maya finally decided it was time to try new things. She started small — ordering a dish she had never heard of at a restaurant — and found herself genuinely excited by the experience. Inspired, she signed up for a weekend pottery workshop and discovered a hidden talent for shaping clay. Each new attempt taught her something unexpected about herself. She began to see that stepping outside her comfort zone wasn't scary; it was exhilarating. By the end of the year, she had collected a dozen new hobbies and twice as many good memories.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 새로운 것들을 시도하다, 즉 익숙하지 않은 활동이나 경험에 도전하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 안전지대를 벗어나 새로운 경험을 해보도록 권유하거나 격려할 때 자주 사용된다. 음식, 취미, 직업 등 다양한 맥락에서 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'try'는 고대 프랑스어 'trier(선별하다, 검증하다)'에서 유래했으며, 영어에서 '시도하다'의 의미로 확장되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 개방적인 태도를 강조하는 표현으로, 도전보다는 가벼운 호기심과 탐험의 뉘앙스가 강하다. 일상적인 대화에서 자연스럽게 쓰인다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Traveling solo is a great way to try new things.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 혼자 여행하는 것은 새로운 것을 시도하기에 아주 좋은 방법이에요.
